column4: Help please!! I just applied some updates, rebooted and now my system boots to a busybox cli!
Are you sure it's busybox? or do you just mean CLI?
Can you boot normally in recovery mode?
nope.  I hit esc on the grub, turned off spash and quiet, and it shows mounting problems for root.  I'm wondering if my uuid changed?
were these just run-of-the-mill updates?
Well, your UUID isn't *supposed* to change... Have you tried recovery mode (If you answered that already, I apologize)
i tried recovery, it barfs too
you have to specify your partitions grub-style
I didn't change anything, the defaults that ubuntu put in grub are what i was using.
Or maybe not...I don't remember
I was saying that in answer to your question about changing the root to /
Honestly, though, I'd be surprised if your UUID changed. Why do you think it did?
how far along in the boot process do you get?
yes
unless you decide to phically change how your drives are connected, you'll be fint
no, in fstab
hehe... talking to your self is the first sign of impending mental collapse!!
which version of Ubuntu are you running?
I had that kind of trouble between dapper and edgy
now you know to watch fstab closely, lest updates conspire against you
it marks a file as immutable. read the chattr man page
already there
